p: The antibacterial test results showed a more significant O. speciosa fixed oil activity against K. pneumoniae KP-ATCC 10031 (MIC = 406.37 μg/mL) and S. aureus SA-ATCC 6538 (MIC = 812.75 μg/mL), as shown in Table 4. For the other bacterial strains, including standard and multiresistant strains, the oil had an MIC ≥ 1024 μg/mL.
